headline: freezing rain warning in effect
description:
Freezing rain tonight into Saturday night.

What:
Ice accumulations of 2 to 5 mm possible.

When:
Beginning tonight and continuing through Saturday night.

Additional information:
Patchy freezing rain or freezing drizzle is possible today. Freezing rain will become more widespread tonight and will be mixed with ice pellets and snow at times. Temperatures are expected to rise above the freezing mark on Saturday for most areas, however it is possible that Lansdowne House may remain below the freezing mark throughout the day. Where temperatures rise above the freezing mark lower ice accumulations are expected.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
instruction: Beware of branches or electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.
